This version had fish sauce, sugar, chili and bottled lime juice.  It lacked the sparkle that should have gone along with the crunch.  Unfortunately, doctoring Som Tom with chili after the preparation is a marginal adjustment.  Having the chili in with the preparation helps the flavor spread throughout the preparation.  

Being spoiled by a native who enjoyed this salad as much as I did, the preparation here does not compare.  I must try Nunthaporn's again for other items.  As of now, 2 stars is the best I can give.

The food is good. I've probably eaten here five times in the past month. Its priced very reasonably. The thai basil and Evil Jungle Princess are great. A few complaints I have: there's a waiter whose name I don't know, but he wears glasses and is always there-  he has awkwardly stared at me for long periods of time while I was eating. Enough that its made me uncomfortable. I don't really like getting stared at while eating. Also, they have a dish called "Garlic Lover" that should be renamed "Black Pepper Lover". Both times I ordered it, there was visibly too much black pepper and I could feel it crunching in my teeth as I ate my food. It really ruins what would otherwise be a good dish. But other than that, the place is fine. I'll keep coming here.

Well, it hurts me to write this, but I feel I have to do it. Without a doubt, this is our favorite place for Thai food. We love our " USUAL " server, Irving ( sorry if I spelled it incorrectly! ). But the other day we came in for lunch and ordered our GO TO dish Pad Thai. Well, the LITTLE FELLOW, who apparently is a family member of the owners had some difficulty understanding what I had requested, and as I tried to explain to him what I wanted, our regular server came by, and I mentioned to him that " you know what we normally get. "This LITTLE FELLOW flipped out and was damn near yelling at me about how he was part of the family, and he knows the food better then our regular guy. I was shocked as was the company I was with.
I am now in a puzzled state as to whether or not I want to return to this place. Perhaps as long as I do not have this individual wait on us, I 'll be content. Otherwise, I will not eat there when he is working.
Again, this hurts me deeply to say and write this. We love our little THIA restaurant.
Had lunch at noon on a Saturday. Not too busy. Very good service. Clean. All 4 of us had different entrees and all were very good. Will return to try something different.

Went to this little place on Main Street in Mesa after a matinee performance at the MAC with a group of friends. Great pad thai with shrimp (lots of shrimp!) I was a little frustrated that they didn't offer two of the iced tea choices that were printed in their menu (server explanation: We don't serve that anymore.) I finally ordered a regular iced tea NO LEMON, and of course what did it come with.......lemon!  It was an off time for dinner (around 5 PM) but the place was pretty full and the service (as has been mentioned here) was SLOW. Also, interestingly enough, our table of 6 (and we ordered all together) was served at three different times. First two orders came out, about 5 minutes later 3 more, and about 5 minutes after that the last one. ??? 
The food is good and I would probably go back, but I will know next time about the service!

I've been eating at Nunthaporn for years. It is my "go-to" for Thai food. I've never had a bad dish and it's because Nunthaporn(pronounced nun-tha-pon), the owner prepares the food herself, fresh every time. 

Prepare to wait for fresh food, so bring good friends, but it's worth it...believe me! I read a couple reviews complaining about this, but if you want frozen garbage nuked in the back, hit McDonald's or something.

My absolute favorite is a coconut-based dish called evil jungle princess. I hold the mushrooms because I just don't like mushrooms, but that's okay because everything is made to order the way you want it. Sometimes, I kick the heat up to a 3, but I personally don't go higher so I can still taste the delicious flavor in everything. 

To top off your meal, I recommend the coconut gelato. It's flavored with real coconut, not just a flavoring, so you get little bits of coconut in every bite. Great place to have a nice sit down with family, friends, or a business meeting.

PRE SHOW FLOP

Reservations made days in advance, and then confirmed by text message, yet extremely vague as the date wasn't included.

When we arrived we entered an very crowded lobby/ front desk area. Not only was it crowded but nobody was happy. There was a large group that wanted the big empty table in the middle that was being held for a reservation. This group did not make a reservation but had been looking at that table empty for almost 30 minutes and had agreed to split up.

When we finally spoke with the host/server/ owner/manager? (older gentleman) he did not have our reservation and the text they sent us without the date was insufficient to get our reserved table. He was short, curt and rude. He was stressed out and completely overwhelmed.

With show time in an hour and lack of options on Main st we waited for a resolution. Finally sat our service was off and rushed. It was also rude and uncomfortable. It appeared the entire place was in meltdown.

Now that service is out of the way lets talk food. IT WAS TERRIBLE!!!!!
I expected even just a little more but of the 4 dishes including  Tom ka Ga (sp) Soup, Black Pepper shrimp, a Curry, and Pad Thai it was all HORRIBLE and just barely edible. Beers arrive on the warm side, maybe 55 or 60 degrees and the sake was soured. We payed and left as we had already seen that host //// lash out at us and others. I was not even going to bother complaining. They had to know what a shit show they were producing that night.

We came here with friends who have eaten here often. We ate on a Friday night around 7:30. There wasn't a long wait to be seated. 
The service wasn't bad. But we had heard about the service being hit or miss. I guess our table didn't need much attention anyways. It helps that they have water jugs on the table. Once you're seated you're only attended to for ordering and clearing dishes. 

The food was so good!! We tried Chicken Pad Thai at spicy level 3 and pork Thai fried rice. My husband and I shared and felt full! Good portions. 

We would definitely recommend coming here again.

I've been to a lot of Thai restaurants in AZ and there are few as good as this place.  The pad thai is awesome with shrimp here, the seafood's fresh and delicious.  They also have some items you can't find at your average Thai restaurant here,  the mincemeat dishes like larb in particular is great.  Try ordering something unusual from this place, I haven't had anything short of delicious here.

I have been spoiled with some great Thai food, and this place is... adequate. My wife got the massaman curry and I decided to try something new with the jungle curry. They were both good, but not absolutely amazing. The massaman was a bit too sweet for me, and the jungle curry was nothing to write home about. The server was not terribly attentive. So overall it was a good experience, but we will likely not return.

Walked in with a party of 6. Two customers in the restaurant. One waitress looks at us and then looks away. Her coworker unenthusiastically asks "how many". As I walk towards the restroom she says "excuse me we're going to need you to wait in the front". That attitude was all I needed to hear, so we turned around and left. Go down the street to Thai Spice, which is 2 miles away, and way better in terms of service and ambiance and the food is great too.

What a pleasant surprise. Came in here not knowing the area very well and came across this place. It was very clean and the staff, although very busy, were friendly. 

We ordered the Tom Yum soup with chicken. It was a lighter colored broth, so I was afraid it wouldn't have much flavor. I was totally wrong! It was very delicious and I would go back there just to get more.

I also ordered a spicy chicken dish with baby corns, lime basil, green beans and bamboo shoots which was also very tasty. It did have slivers of ginger through out, but if your not a fan, they are easy to avoid. 

The only reason I give them 3 stars (really it's a 3 &1/2 star) was because it was a busy night and service was just a little slow. (But, they were hustling and moving quickly to keep up.)

I look forward to returning to try the sticky rice for dessert. All on all, this place is worth a 1st try and maybe a return.
Best Thai food in town. Amazing lunch prices. Be sure to try the Thai iced tea and the cashew chicken.

Sean our server was great! Super fast service! We ordered the Panang Curry Chicken and it was good. I ordered the Thai Fried Rice (with chicken) and loved it. This is only our second time but I would recommend it. Small but good. Parking in the back of the restaurant. Great everything!

Four star flavor!  My palette was pleased. Came on a Wed, near 5pm. Service was good, food was great. Started off with Thai Tea served in a long tall glass, very good, then ordered Pad Thai, excellent taste and large portion for 10 bucks.
It was our first time at the restaurant and the waitress suggested some very good food. The curries are good and we especially liked the crab rolls. It is a great place for a quick meal.

We planned ahead to have dinner here and made reservations the for 6:15 PM before going to the 7:30 PM showing of Dreamgirls at the MAC. 
Arrived around 6:20 and was seated immediately. The place was crowded and the service seemed to be a bit slow. We all ready knew what we wanted so we ordered our meal at 6:30 PM. 

My wife and I sat and conversed over hot Jasmine tea. Some time had past and the server came to our table and told us that it would be another 10 minutes before our order would be ready and do we want to wait. I looked at the time and it was 7:10. I told him 'NO, void our ticket. So, we got up and left for the theatre. 

If they were on Top Chef, I would have told them to 'pack your knives and LEAVE'.
The food is excellent there, but if you can't produce in a timely manner, then WHY even open.

I think their problem is that they possible have one chef and when the restaurant is crowded, there is NO WAY they can keep the patrons HAPPY.
There was a another table with two ladies and they were able to eat just the appetizer.

I hope the owners of the restaurant are reading these comments from YELP because they have to open their eyes to see they are above the heads and NEED to hire another CHEF in the kitchen.

If there was an option of ZERO stars, that's what I would have rated them.

This has quickly become our favorite thai place. We also frequent the Wild Thai Tiger in phoenix, but it is a bit of a drive and pricey.

We discovered this place on a Cruisin on Main St car event, and everytime we have eaten there we are happy.

The prices are more than fair, the staff is always great (we always have the same waitress it seems.

The Crispy spring rolls are the best, and I always have the Trout, which is really good, or my favorite there, the Cashew Chicken. It is never too spicy, and the portion size is Great.
My Fiance is a vegetarian and loves the different curries with tofu. We have never had a bad experience here, out of about 35 times.

I just had lunch here and it was AMAZING. I love this place. I had the Pad Thai and my brother in law had the cashew chicken. This place is fresh tasting, fulfilling, and pretty inexpensive. I would recommend this place to anyone. Actually, we are eating there again tomorrow. Very clean too which is important.
This place is so good. Don't let the stupid white people who had to wait 2 minutes for a refill steer you from here. The waiter we had was the man, food was so good and it was real quick.

Nunthaporn's is a great place for a date night. Located in downtown Mesa right off the main strip. The restaurant is along the art walk and surrounded by beautiful scenery. Service is very fast and the food is pretty good. My husband and I ordered my favorite dish pad woon sen. portions were not big enough to share but tasty. We also ordered the Thai tea; it was a pretty small size. Food was good but not great, serving portions were small, and the service is okay but I still recommend it for a fun night out.

Got the green curry tofu lunch special ($8) to go. The lunch includes 2 small spring rolls, your choice of brown or white rice, and if you eat-in soup is included too. It was well packaged and ready in about 10 minutes. 

The curry was a medium level of spiciness to me and had a lot of vegetables and soft tofu. The sauce was nicely seasoned and I had a plentiful amount of rice to eat it with. The spring rolls were lightly crispy and a good complement to the curry. The curry was a bit watery though.

The interior is well decorated with light wood accents. I'll have to eat in one of these days to enjoy the ambiance! Overall it was a good meal and I'd go back to try more off the menu.

3.5/5

This is a superb place to dine.  Curries or pineapple fried rice tend to be my faves.  The service is excellent and each table has a carafe of water sitting on it, a nice touch as we move into the hot summer.  I highly recommend it for a place to take a date.

Best Thai food around! We've tried quite a few Thai places and this seems the most authentic. Love the sweet and sour chicken, Thai fried chicken rice and som tom. Eat here all the time and have never had a bad experience!

The food is pretty good but the service is HORRIBLE.  We came about 8:15, they close, and I mean CLOSE at 9.  You better have your food in a bag by then or they will throw you and your plate out the door.  They rushed us to order, practically stood by the table while we ate, nearly took the food out from under us.  Sorry, I am desperate for ethnic food here but won't go back.

I decided to try this restaurant because I have become familiar with it in the past. I got my table and needed to use the restroom. I had to wait for the use of the restroom and all of a sudden a person darted out that look like a waiter. I noticed when I went to wash my hands that the sink was dry. That's sparked in my mind the possibility that the waiter had not been cleanly after using the restroom. I couldn't get the thought out of my mind all during the meal. He also subsequently served me my meal which was even a more frustrating. I wasn't sure how to handle that situation so I just ate my meal and basically chalked up that I wouldn't be visiting the restaurant again. On a scale of other Thai food restaurants I'm only giving them two stars because I felt that their food was not as outstanding as some of the other restaurants that I have visited. Certainly restaurants like Thai Chili 2 Go and Thai Basil have it going on and they are really good restaurants to visit, and I would recommend looking into them. I think the history of this restaurant and some of the awards that they have one in the past, but management needs to take a close look at making sure health standards are kept at the forefront of their operations. I'm not trying to downgrade this restaurant, but I feel that maybe there are some things that need to be looked into.

had the evil jungle princess, it was freaking awesome. hubbie had something with beef and green beans, awesome too, but could not steal my heart from the jungle princess. I will eat here many times again. prices are good, nice relaxed atmosphere. slower paced than some restaurants but don't go there starving; enter, relax, order and eat whats your hurry?
Best Thai food in Phoenix!! The jungle curry is to die for. The other favorites are green curry fried rice, papaya salad and larb (tofu and chicken)!!

Terrible ... I went yesterday for the second time.  My boyfriend ordered fed curry with Shrimp and i ordered yellow . The Red Curry was ordered Spicy but it wasn't sooo spicy it was kind of hard to eat.  The yellow curry was terrible.  4 sad shrimp 6 hard potatoes and the broth seemed diluted with water thin and runny.  The potatoes were hard just like the 1st time . And the thai teas were barely filled . I will not be back

I come from Southern California, the land of the million Thai food places, and I'm a big fan of Thai, so I've had Thai food at a lot of different places. So when a few years ago I went to a convention whose main event was at 12 W Main, across the street from a Thai place in Mesa, I had to try it out. And I'm glad I did - I've been coming back once a year for that convention, and make sure to visit this place every year when I do!

This place is *slightly* more expensive than the average around there, but the food is just as good as places in LB (better than some!) I *always* get noodle dishes, but with a name like "Evil Jungle Princess" (and a description including several of my favorite things), I couldn't help but try it. I made the right choice - I can't help but order the same thing every time (I can get pad thai and pad see ew anywhere, I haven't found any other place with the same recipe for this one.) I've tried bites of a few other things, though, and they've been pretty good too. 

Hilariously, this year when I was back a couple weeks ago, we (this convention) basically ate all their food - by the time I got there, they were out of several things. They handled it well, though.
Omg this place is awesome.  Atmosphere is airy,  clean and inviting.  Green curry and Pana ng both amazing.  First time here and def won't be my last.

Oh Nunthaporn's, why you so good?  Love this place.  My friends and I go all the time for lunch on Saturday.  They have a great lunch special menu.  I always get the Pad Thai and my friends get the Cashew Chicken.  For $7.50 you get a bowl of soup, some wontons, and a spring roll to start.  Then you pick your entree.  The soup is a simple broth with some veggies.  Light and easy.  The spring rolls are so good.  Fried to perfection.  The Pad Thai is the best I've ever had.  The rice noodles are tossed in a delicious peanut sauce.  Mixed with onion, bean sprouts, tofu, and your choice of meat (I always get the chicken).  They always give you a huge portion which is great.  You can take almost half of it home with you.
This is just a nice place for lunch or dinner.  It's clean, the service is great and fast, and it's right off Main Street.  Also, they have a lunch punch card.  Once you get 10 lunches, you get a free one!  Pretty cool.
A very solid choice for good Thai food. They are good about meeting orders and are nice.

In the last month, I have eaten at this restaurant twice.  

The first time was in early February on a Monday evening when I was doing a photo shoot.  We stopped here to go to the bathroom that I came back afterwards to eat dinner with my son.   Initially, the service was very slow....we waited forever to get a menu, drink, or to give our order...but it was ok since my son & I were just chatting and reviewing pictures anyways.   When the food arrived it was delicious!  For the first time I tried a curry without coconut milk, the Jungle Curry and LOVED it and want to learn how to make it!   My son (age 7) also loved his food.  He said it was the best Thai food he ever had.  And on top of it all, our sever told me all about fresh peppercorns  - which were in my curry - I love learning new things about food! 

I visited again a few weeks later when I was in the area for a class at the Mesa Arts Center.   I was with a grou, and tried the Penang Curry Lunch Special.  It was very good.   And the service was fantastic!

I do plan to visit again in the future.

It's good and pretty flavorful, although I've tried four different entrees now and they all are on the sweet, rather than spicy, side.  Maybe next time I will specify that I want some kick to it.  The lunch special is a great deal for $7.50. I will be back!

Food was really good; service was slow. 

They were definitely WAY UNDERSTAFFED. Those poor guys were running around like chickens with their heads cut off. Frenzied. Far too many customers for just a couple of servers to keep up with . . . even good ones. 

Customers were waiting in front when there were empty tables. 

Recommendation: Could have solved some of the problems by having a "hostess" during busy times . . . someone to clear tables, seat customers and take checks. Then the servers could concentrate on what they do best . . . serve, and make sure customers are happy, so they will return. Just makes good business sense to me. 

Good food is not always enough. Only go when you have plenty of time to spare.

This is some of the best Thai food in Mesa. The pad Thai, a traditional favorite, it is especially good here. But be careful on the spiciness, because ordering anything above a "5" might burn your mouth!  The staff is attentive and very professional, and quick. I was here with a group of about 39 people, and they were spot on. Everybody in the group ate at pretty much the same time, which is pretty miraculous for that number of people in a relatively modest size restaurant.  I highly recommend this place and definitely will come back!
Excellent Thai food at great prices. This is a favorite lunchtime spot of mine. I'm never disappointed by the quality and flavors.
Love the pad Thai with chicken here, I always go with a 2 on 1-5 spicy scale. I have not tried something on the menu I didn't love. They have a diverse menu and the service and food is authentic.
Springs rolls are awesome. Curry delicious. And service was outstanding,
Off the hook good! Definitely the real deal. Not just fresh and plentiful, but steaming hot and priced more than fair.EAT HERE... it's that good.
Absolutely incredible. I had the sweet and sour chicken. My new favorite place. They are busy. Came down in a Saturday night around 7pm. Busy. The cashew chicken was also good.

This is our favorite Thai restaurant! We are huge fans of ALL of their curries and ALL of their noodle dishes. It is so difficult for me to order from this restaurant because I hate choosing only one dish. It would be an amazing (but weird) development if they turned into a Thai Tapas restaurant so I could order tiny portions of 15 different dishes LOL. They have 4 stars because on busy nights, the service can be quite slow. We usually order for pick up as a result. If this is your first time at a Thai restaurant, I would recommend the Pad Thai, the Yellow Curry, and the Sticky Rice with Mango. Enjoy!

My group went for lunch on a Friday. We were seated immediately, as it wasn't busy at all but it took 20 minutes before our server even acknowledged that we were there. When she did finally take our order, she didn't bring out our drinks right away. We actually had to bring it up twice with her, and we got our food before we got anything to drink. It was ridiculous especially with some of us ordering spicy curry. She wasn't apologetic at all and just seemed to not care about the customers, overall not professional.
The food was great though! I had the Evil Jungle Princess and the mango rice for dessert. I'd give it 4/5, but I've never had such terrible service before coming here. We were all disappointed because the reviews are great. Next time we'll just order to go.

Great food and friendly service.
Loved the appetizers and shared several main dishes family-style.  Try a few dishes and take the leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  

We have been there with friends several times and have never been disappointed.  Go a little early or late for lunch or dinner for immediate seating.

Extremely solid drunken noodle. At first bite, I almost gave this place a five-star. The noodles were cooked with a very hot wok to give it that heated flavour, but nothing was burnt. It was very sweet and white peppery and basily and garlicky. It wasn't wet and drenched with sauce either,and the noodle was cooked del dente. I hate it when I order drunken noodle and it's filled with large red and green peppers, but this dish had no peppers - bamboo shoots, carrots, green beans, and this type of dry corn i dont know the name of. So Good! I had to take away the fifth star as i ploughed on through my noodle though, as the pork and vegetables were not flavourful at all. I ended up picking out the noodle only and left the rest (I wasn't hungry anyway). I wish i can find drunken noodle like this everywhere i go.

After tax, the noodle was less than $10 and i was pretty happily full. There were people coming in steadily throughout the night. The service can probably get a little spotty since there were only two people manning the floor and the dude waiter seemed young and very new to the job. He kept asking people if they wanted a table or booth even though the booth was full - kinda funny when you're sitting directly facing the front.

We spent a month in Thailand, so I feel like I'm allowed to say this is some of the most authentic Thai food I've had! The food is so so yummy and the service is exceptional! I love the crispy spring rolls, massaman curry, and the Thai Basil Chicken!

We went hoping to have a good experience - the place was noisy, there was at least one empty table, and there seemed to be sufficient staff -  yet we stood waiting for acknowledgement from the hostess for over 5-10 minutes.  After having her come up to the front and still not acknowledge us several times, we decided they clearly didn't want our business and left.  How this place received a Best of Phoenix vote is beyond me, given that they seem to have no care at all in acknowledging their customers.

it's good. got the pad thai lunch special. i never get anything else in thai restaurants.

But it wasnt as tasty as the other pad thai's ive had before. I loved Palee's Crown but apparently they closed.

I guess they use a little less sweet sauce, and more diced tofu than I would have liked since my choice of meat to add in was Fried Tofu. Tofu overload.

but honestly it was edible, and wasnt horrible. 

Nice place, ambiance and all. I wish I had time to eat in and have their soup of the day that comes with the lunch special.

I've had the best of Thai there and the curries are to die for...the service can be inconsistent, but the food is always top notch, so it's worth it to be a little patient. The owner is a gem and really cares about her customers.

This is my second time here, I tried the 'Pad Thai' this time and it was a little salty but still pretty good. They serve a small soup and egg roll as a complimentary appetizer, which the egg roll tastes awesome and I really wish they gave you two. After the meal is done Im always pretty stuffed. Plan at least a 45 min meal time when going with a few people.
Amazing food!  The Pad Thai was perfect!  If you are planning to eat here before a show at the Mesa Arts Center then make sure you get a reservation because this place gets packed!
Loved this place.  The green curry was awesome!

the food is decent--not memorable or special, but acceptable.

The service, however, is appalling. It's been a while since I've had such bad service. The staff who greeted us were pretty surly, as if they resented our coming into the restaurant--which should have been a signal to leave. That, and the fact that there were fewer patrons there than at any other restaurant on Main Street.

A couple of menus were slammed down on the table in front of us. Our order was pretty simple--two pad thai, one without chives--but the kitchen still managed to get it wrong. I had to ask three times for water, and no one came to check on us until long after we were done. And throughout all of it, the staff was just pissy and ill-tempered.

As we left, my lunch partner commented on how empty the place was. I said, "Yeah, it's not surprising, given how terrible the service is" just as the waitress walked by.

She made a point of smiling and saying brightly, "Thanks for coming in!" But it was too little too late.  

You have to wonder how places like Nunthaporn's stay in business.  I admit I'm still fairly new to Mesa, but there has to be better Thai food somewhere in town. If you really want good food on Main Street, try Mango's Mexican restaurant just down the street.

The food is okay,  not the best I've had,  but not the worst either.  
Now on the service. .. I swear I left 5 years older it was so slow.  It's a good thing that we get our own water jar at the table because I swear we didn't have a waiter.  Only go here if you're prepared to wait a while

I love Thai and here i had some of the best in Mesa! i'm not a fan of places where Thai means 'super hot, have-no-idea-what-food-this-is-hot'; i'm actually a wimpy coconut yellow curry type: but the 3 of us agreed it was the best Thai we had! 

one ordered Thai hot, another 'just' hot and i the milder dish. mind you, it still had a little kick to it - but in all 3 dishes the flavors still came through. 

we had Thai ice tea (love it!) since it was lunchtime and the workday wasn't over :(

i recommend you try this gem in downtown Mesa ! let me know what you think..
since we went for a late lunch i can't comment on the noise level, (it was quiet only a few customers) but the service was great and our orders came out with perfect timing.
I finally went to Nunthaporn's Thai Cuisine and I was so pleased with my food. I ordered the Pad KEE-MAO and Thai Ice tea, it was delicious!!!

We live in the area and eat here at least once month... Sometimes more. The food is super yummy. We always order double Pad Thai for leftovers :-).      We do take out so I don't know about service. But the people are always pleasant. 
Definitely try this place when you're near downtown Mesa.
Yellow curry and the shrimp fried was tasty with a lot of vegetables. Service was ok. The peach tea was very sweet so heads up to those who are diabetic. It's quaint and the restrooms were clean.

SOLID Thai food. Some of the best I've had outside of Chang Mai. The best part about it? It's an amazing Thai spot IN DOWNTOWN MESA. Yeah, I'm sure you've been hearing a lot of DTMesa lately... you know, the awesome comic book store, Evermore Nevermore, the new grindhouse called The Royale, Bak'd, SHIT'S BLOWING UP! So now you can go get great Thai food, shop, buy some art, some vintage clothing, and catch an ultra-gore slasher flick all in Downtown within two blocks. Amazing transformation and having a sick Thai spot just makes things sweeter.

Only complaint is it's a bit pricey, but I'm rollin' in dough so IDGaF.

This was my favorite Thai place in AZ aside from Pato in Flagstaff. We drove out from Tempe to eat here regularly. The food has always been great and we always ordered the green curry and pad kee mao. Today we went for lunch special. We ordered what we always do pad kee Mao and green curry. Our order came out and we received our order of curry however the other dish was wrong. We made the server aware and he took our food back, he wrote down pad see ew. Mistakes happen right? No big deal. Until the OWNER comes out and says that we made a mistake. It was our fault. I have never been treated that way at a restaurant ever. We will NEVER eat here again. I am so disappointed in the way this owner treated us as customers.

I did not review this place?!?! I must be losing my mind. 

Anyway, I went here probably a month and a half ago for lunch with a couple friends and it was just alright. I like how lunch came with soup and a spring roll...that was really good, but when the food came out, they had brought me the wrong thing. I would have been fine just eating what they brought (red curry....not sure how that sounded like drunken noodles, but whatever), but I generally judge a place on their drunken noodles and told the waitress. She fixed the problem, but it took a really long time for the new food to come out, so long that my friends were pretty much done when I got mine. Also, I think she forgot how spicy I had told her originally because the drunken noodles were not spicy at all. So I *might* give this place another shot, but it's not first on my list...

Love Thai food and it's so close to the Mesa Arts Center - perfect before a concert, right? Summary: I would go here again for the food, but the service was very confused. 

We came early and were almost the first people there for dinner. We had 3 people stop by the table for our drink order so we were a little confused who our waiter was. We ordered an appetizer (Cheese and Shrimp rolls), and soup (Poh Tag) and a couple of entrees. The rolls came without delay and were delicious, but soup was then brought out - to the table next to us who had just ordered. Yup - it was our soup which we could see (as they ate it) included tofu. Then our entrees arrived - to the same wrong table. We all figured out that error immediately and they were switched to our table - again, delicious. But we finally caught one of the 3 waiters and said we would still like our soup. They apologized and brought soup - with vegetables and no tofu. We figure it was the soup the other table originally ordered. We sent it back and they were persuaded that they had mis-delivered the soup. Eventually our soup came (with the seafood and tofu and another apology) and we had it for dessert.

I would give a higher review if they had taken the soup off our bill after all the screw-ups, but they didn't. So figure this as 4 stars for the food and 2 for the service.

Always have a nice lunch or dinner here! The hours are weird sometimes I end up forgetting they close down to switch to dinner:( love the curry chicken puffs? Something like that... AMAZING. wonton soup, AMAZING. and of course the curry dishes. AMAZING.


I will say though I have came few times and the servers haven't been too rude but they are pushy! Maybe I just never have good luck with servers... But there is a really nice lady server I will have to ask for her name next time and update this review but she is always super nice and welcoming!!

By my other Thai restaurant favorites, Nunthaporn's came up short meeting my expectations.  For three adults, one order of sat tay consisted of 4 stickers...  why not 6?  We shared a yellow curry dish which tasted good, and they offered one small cup of steamed rice to split three ways.  My favorite fried banana dessert is on the menu, but wasn't available.  Small serving sizes seems to be a custom here.

Went here the other day with my bf because I'm determined to find a thai place equal to Sugar Thai in Ellensburg, WA...The service here was pretty good although one waiter kept doing this weird nose/throat clearing thing that was kind of disgusting while we were eating.. They were pretty attentive though.

I got the Drunken noodles because I have had them at other places and wanted to compare. I was an idiot however and ordered a 3 star spicy out of 4... aaaaand I could barely eat it let alone taste it. So it was probably really yummy judging by our other foods quality but I don't know... We also order pad thai which was good. And the Spring rolls which were very good. Their peanut sauce is bomb.

I'd probably come back to try other stuff.. They didn't have bubble/boba tea though which I really wanted.

I want to like this place, but the lack of service has definitely put a nail in the coffin in it for me!  I have ordered take out and have also dined in a couple of times each.  For take out, I had to wait an additional 20 minutes after I was told it would be ready in 20 minutes.  As for dining in, the first time I walked out after 10 minutes of not being acknowledged.  The second time the entire lunch took about 1.5 hours.  The final straw was today when I tried to call in a to go order.  I was put on hold for 6.5 minutes.  When I called back, the phone was off of the hook for 3 attempts.  When I finally got someone on the line they proceeded to put me on hold again for 2 minutes and whomever picked up the phone thereafter was extremely rude.  I will never order or go to Nunthaporns again!

I love thai food and eat it whenever I can. This is the first place in the whole valley I have found that serves my favorite dish evil jungle princess. It is so tasty and they do it very well. They are always busy and servers are always working hard. My fiance has had a few different dishes and is always happy with his picks as well.

I came across this gem of a restaurant when I did a random search for restaurants close to an event I planned on attending.  The food was outstanding and the service is far beyond the norm.  The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. They correctly anticipated when we were ready to order, when we were ready to have plates cleared away, and when we were ready for the check. The food came out at just the right temperature and the timing could not have been any better. If you like Thia cuisine please check this place out.  I will be returning very soon!

This restaurant feels like a hidden gem every time I eat there. Even though the food is amazing, there's never a wait to be seated and the service is very quick. Every dish we've tried has been delicious. I love the Evil Jungle Princess, panang curry, and, of course, the pad thai. Portions are a good size, too.

This is the only place to go for great supper Thia food
The lunch special is awesome 
We eat here in and take out often
Wait staff is helpful and knowledgeable 
 
You need to try it

Always the best quality ingredients for the tastiest classic Thai dishes!  The chef is from Thailand and goes back every year to keep up to speed with the latest authentic techniques and flavors.  Definitely worth a visit if you like Eesan/Southeast Asian cuisine!
Food was amazing! Service was a little slow but couldn't blame the waiters for being understaffed. But the food was well worth the wait.

Great little Thai spot in the heart of downtown Mesa. We came in through the back entrance as it had been pouring outside. Unusual for Phoenix, but it did happen! The restaurant is clean and the wait staff was friendly and helpful. We had a few questions about the menu that were answered honestly, so thank you! I had one of the best Thai noodle dishes ever, filled with tofu and veggies, cooked perfectly. My hubby had a rice dish that was too Thai hot for me, but absolutely perfect for him. Yeah!!! Very Good Dining Experience.

Simply put, the service was slower than Moses. But the food wasn't bad.

We were going to Southwest Shakespeare Company tonight to see Taming of the Shrew and met here for dinner. The patio was a great idea as it's one of those lovely January evenings. There were maybe 4 full tables of 2-3 people total at this place when we arrived. We ordered appetizers and the first was quick but then the chicken satay took twice as long as expected. When we ordered the second appetizer, we ordered our meals. I believe we all had the pad thai (three of us). Nothing too difficult to prepare, but we left waiting... and waiting.... and waiting. I took an hour for our meal, which was too long for a smaller place without a lot of people on a a Friday evening. No less than 5 different wait staff attended to us at different times through the evening so they weren't understaffed. "Our" waitress (blond haired) apologized for the slowness and said she "yelled at the kitchen staff for" us. When we paid the bill, we noticed someone named Joey was supposed to be the waiter. I am pissed that anyone other than this waitress would receive the tip. I hope that didn't happen. Don't know if I will be back here anytime soon. There's a new mexican place across the street; I may go there next time.

Oh yes, as for the food. I have had better pad thai. I asked for a 5 and it was almost too hot to eat. Very sad indeed.
